title: Blood Count (CBC)
desc: A Complete Blood Count (CBC) test measures several components and features of your blood, including red and white blood cells, hemoglobin, hematocrit, and platelets.

title: Basic Metabolic Panel (BMP)
desc: A Basic Metabolic Panel (BMP) includes tests for calcium, glucose, electrolytes, and renal function. It helps assess your blood sugar level, electrolyte balance, and kidney function.

title: Thyroid Function Tests
desc: Thyroid Function Tests measure the levels of thyroid hormones (T3 and T4) and thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in your blood to assess thyroid gland function.

title: Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (CMP)
desc: A Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (CMP) includes tests for liver function, kidney function, blood sugar levels, and electrolytes. It provides a broader overview of your body's chemical balance and metabolism.

title: Urinalysis
desc: A Urinalysis is a test of your urine used to detect and manage a wide range of disorders, such as urinary tract infections, kidney disease, and diabetes.

title: Prothrombin Time (PT/INR)
desc: The Prothrombin Time (PT) test and its derived measure (INR) are used to assess the blood's ability to clot and to monitor patients on anticoagulant therapy.

title: Liver Function Tests
desc: Liver Function Tests measure various enzymes, proteins, and substances in the blood that are indicative of liver health and function.
